citation.article-title: Acanthopleuribacter pedis gen. nov., sp. nov., a marine bacterium isolated from a chiton, and description of Acanthopleuribacteraceae fam. nov., Acanthopleuribacterales ord. nov., Holophagaceae fam. nov., Holophagales ord. nov. and Holophagae classis nov. in the phylum 'Acidobacteria'.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Acanthopleuribacter pedis sp. nov.
Acanthopleuribacter pedis (pe′dis. L. gen. n. pedis of the foot, referring to the isolation of the type strain from the foot of a chiton).
In addition to the characteristics listed for the genus, the following are observed.
Cells are 0.7–1.0×2.4–4.7 μm and motile by peritrichous flagella.
Colonies on marine agar are circular, smooth and yellow in colour.
Grows on marine agar at 15–30 °C (optimally at 30 °C).
Growth is observed on R2A agar supplemented with 50–150 % ASW (optimally with 70–120 % ASW).
Catalase and oxidase activities are present.
Nitrate and nitrite are not reduced, acid is not produced from glucose and indole is not produced from tryptophan.
β-Glucosidase and protease activities are present.
Arginine dihydrolase and urease activities are not detected.
Growth by fermenting glucose under anaerobic conditions is not observed.
The following substrates are utilized for growth: α-d-glucose, l-alanine, hydroxy-l-proline, l-serine, l-threonine, inosine, uridine and thymidine.

Activities in the API ZYM strip are detected for alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase.
Tests for esterase C4, ester lipase C8, cystine arylamidase and β-glucosidase are weakly positive.
Activities of lipase C4, chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase are not observed.
The quinone system of the type strain consists of MK-6 (57.8 %) and MK-7 (42.2 %).
The type strain, FYK2218T (=NBRC 101209T =KCTC 12899T), was isolated from a chiton, Acanthopleura japonica, from the Boso peninsula, Japan.
